parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From the same as zoon and a derivative of ginomai; to engender alive, i.e. to rescue from death.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
A profession, confession. From the same as homologeo; acknowledgment.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Pontius. Of Latin origin; apparently bridged; Pontius, a Roman.
Pilate. Of Latin origin; close-pressed, i.e. Firm; Pilatus, a Roman.
